comments.text: Good amount of space to pull in, cars going slow, a car stopped and offered me ride while I was still messing with my bag.

I'm not sure, whether it's exactly at this crossway, but here on the panamericana in the end of the city are some traffic lights, where you can easily wait and talk to the cars! Was easy to get a ride northern!
It's very easy getting north here! There are a lot of 'tiendas' and on the right side is a parking lot, so cars can stop easily & go slowly (because of a hill & traffic light)

I got here from Cuenca and directly got a ride continuing to the north. I'D NOT RECOMMEND waiting in the city! Because there is one road around the city and one through it - so here you'll catch all of the cars! It's uphill, so they drive slowly. Same for going south - get dropped of after the roades merge again!

In 200 meters before piaje. The side of the road is wide enough to stay and wait for the car. Traffic is good.

To here you can get by taking a bus from Quitumbe terminal in Quito to Machachi and ask bus driver drop you off in some distance before toll.
Muy facil , como todas las rutas de ecuador , camino a PEDERNALES
Para ir a Manta es muy facil , pasan muchos autos
Desde aqui se puede ir tanto como para Guayaquil , Cuenca , o la frontera con Peru
Rotonda de autos q salen de machala y van hacia Guayaquil
Por aqui hay un peaje , se puede conseguir viaje a Machala muy facil
Take a bus for Chongon.  Get off before the bus leaves the highway and walk 200m more to the toll booth.
Good spot to get to Montañita. PaoloCaracol got a ride in 5 minutes.
PaoloCaracol got a ride to Puerto López. Good spot with a good cardboard.
PaoloCaracol got a ride from Montañita to Santa Elena. Good spot and nice people !
PaoloCaracol hitchhiked from there with a cardboard in direction on Puyo. You can reach this place by walking from the city center of Baños. Get a ride in 10 minutes.

We were three persons (2 guys, 1 lady) going to the National Park "Cajas". No prob to get a ride, 10 minutes waiting and we had a nice ride. And I am sure that you can catch rides from here going to Guayaquil. 
To get to this spot: Take bus #7 from the centre and hop off at Parque de Dragon. The bus costs you $0,25. Have the right coins available for the machine in the bus. Thumbs up!
Great spot in front of main entrance of Machalila National park
Take a ride to Julio Andrade, not so far

I had to walk here from the border to catch a ride, it ended up being three of us though. Once away from the border I got to Quito fast, [Blog Post](http://www.hobospirit.com/hitchhiking-from-colombia-to-ecuador/)
We easily got a ride to Machala. But you have to be careful: The official taxis will think that you pay the driver and that it's an inoffiacial taxi - and then they make problems!
I've done the mistake to not take cars, that just go for 30Min to the north - you should do that! I waited very long on a sunday to get a car that is going further - hopeless!

From this spot you can easily find cars going to the north! The road is uphill, so the cars don't ride that fast (though they are not really slowly) and you'll also have all the cars coming from las Americas.

The direction to Vilcabamba. 
Good road side. Traffic might be pretty low, but people there are so kind. I stopped the first car in less then a minute waiting and got a ride almost to Vilcabamba.

Direction to Loja. The road side is comfortable to stop. Cars are passing by slowly after turn and drivers can see you since the turn, thanks to the straight road and plain part of landscape. The traffic is quite low, though.

Heading to south.
It's a beginning of the bypass way of Ambato. Cars are passing by slowly after turn and the bridge. A lot of trucks and enough space for them to stop.
PaoloCaracol hitchhiked from the gas station until Montañita beach town. There are some cars going in direction of the Ruta del Spondylus. Better to ask the people directly.
Good spot for hitchhike in direction of Archidona, Baeza, Lago Agrio, Quito. PaoloCaracol got a ride to Quito in a pickup. Wait there 20 minutes.
PaoloCaracol hitchhiked from this spot. Got a ride in 15 minutes to Tena. Place yourself just after the bridge.
Toll station - una peaje. Found a lift easily. - I am not sure about the position, but you need 15min/$0,25 by bus.

Place to get off o get a lift in direccion Quito/North. Drivers have to lower their velocity. 
Un buen lugar para bajar o encontrar una oportunidad a Quito/norte.

There is a Toll-Station, where you easily can get a lift in direction north. To get there take a bus from "Terminal Carcelen" But be quick, can be that the guards kick you out. AcÃ¡ hay una peaje. Pero apurate, los chapas normalemente no quieren ayudarte ;)
Take a ride to Ibarra, the guy asked for money, I said I didn't have and he pick me up
Take a ride further, after Chota.
Speed bump before bridge so driver's have to slow down.

It's a bypass way of Cuenca. You can get here easily from the city center (30 minutes walking). Despite most of the traffic is local, you can get a lift closer to the exit out of the city. Interregional trucks are passing by as well.
A bit further after turn to Guayaquil there is enough space on the side of the road to stop cars. Traffic is average. But I got a left right to Cuenca by Taxi driver in half an hour.
Mejor salir un poco de la ciudad , de todos modos muy dificil aqui , mucho trafico interno de la ciudad
PaoloCaracol got a ride to Salango from here. Is not that easy because people are not used to take hitchhikers. Wainting time: 30 minutes +/-.
PaoloCaracol hitchhiked from this spot to Santa Elena. Is not that easy because of the fast trafic. You will need a big cardboard and a good smile !
PaoloCaracol hithhike from this spot to the town of Playas. There is almost no trafic and people are really not used to hichhiking. Wait 30 minutes.

The road is easy accessed by walk from center. There is bus stop there both to south and north, good visibility for both driver and hitchhiker, space to park (from bus stop) ... but for some reason, even after 1h30, didn't manage to get a ride.

There is the main road. Normally it just serves you to get out of Otavalo.
Aqui esta la carretera. Normalemente solo te sirve para salir de Otavalo.
"La Y" - There you will find lifts in direction of Guayaquil.

At the end of Cajabamba a friend and I tried to stop cars and found a lift in 15min. A bit further there are some gas station. Aqui un amigo y yo encontramos alguien quien nos llevÃ³ en 15min. Un poquito por delante hay gasolineras.

To avoid Cayambe. Drivers get slower, but will not stop necessarily. I had a friend in company and we found a lift in 15min.
Para evitar un paro en Cayambe. Conductores bajan la velocidad, pero no van a parar seguramente. En dos encontramos un lift en 15min.
Space at the side of the road for cars, quite steep though

Heading to the border with Peru. Although the road is friendly to stop cars and people around are really pleasant, the traffic is extremely(!) low.

It's possible to rely only on good luck to get a ride to Peru, when taking local rides is not recommended except you are ok walking few days and camp. 
After 50-60 km south from Vilcabamba, there is no paved road up to the border and dirt road is usually in a bad condition due to rains, sometimes even closed.
not many locals going through, got picked up by tourists in the end
pretty bad, i walked all the way to ipiales hitching and couldn't get a ride. might have just been a fluke.
